event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Use <tt>fmdump -v -u <EVENT-ID></tt> to locate the module. Use <tt>fmadm load <module></tt> to load the module after repairing its configuration.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: A Solaris Fault Manager component could not load due to an erroroneous configuration file.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
The Fault Manager loads multiple components, referred to as modules,
which perform fault diagnosis and automated response actions.

The Message ID: FMD-8000-3F indicates that one of the modules failed
to load during fault manager startup.

This indicates the module's configuration file has an error.

   The recommended actions for the system administrator are as follows:

      Identify the affected module (  # fmdump -v -u <EVENT-ID> )


      Attempt to reset and restart the module.  ( # fmadm reset <module> )

      Fix error in the configuration file.

      Load the module after repairing its configuration.   (  # fmadm load <module> )

      Ensure the latest firmware/patches are installed on the system.

      If the failure persists, please contact your Authorized Service Provider.


NOTE


Information applicable to the 'Sun SPARC Enterprise M4000/M5000/M8000/M9000' platforms
can be found in Troubleshooting Doc #88172.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: Automated diagnosis and response for subsequent events associated with this module will not occur.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: The module has been disabled. Events destined for the module will be saved for manual diagnosis.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Solaris Fault Manager component has erroneous configuration file
